Wisdom: فَإِذَا نَظَرَ أَحَدُكُمْ إِلَى امْرَأَةٍ فَأَعْجَبَتْهُ فَلْيَمَسَّ أَهْلَهُ فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ امْرَأَةٌ بِامْرَأَةٍ
enWisdom: Whenever any of you sees a woman whom he finds attractive, he should go to his wife, because she [too] is a woman like her
Many a passion is aroused by a [single] glance

Wisdom: عَمَى الْبَصَرِ خَيْرٌ مِنْ كَثِيرٍ مِنَ النَّظَرِ
enWisdom: The blinding of sight is better than a lot of gazing [at what is forbidden]
A man’s sense of honour is to the extent of his self-respect

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ صَبَابَةٍ [صِيَانَةٍ] اكْتُسِبَتْ مِنْ لَحْظَةٍ
enWisdom: How many a passion has been aroused from a [single] glance!
How many gazes have led to regret!
One who glances [everywhere] freely, his regret increases
One who lowers his gaze relieves his heart
One who frees his gaze occasions (or brings about) his [own] destruction

Wisdom: مَنْ غَضَّ طَرْفَهُ قَلَّ أَسَفُهُ وَأَمِنَ تَلَفَهُ
enWisdom: One who lowers his gaze, his regret reduces and he is saved from harm
One who frees his gaze occasions (or brings about) his [own] destruction
How good a curtailer of lustful desires lowering the gaze is!
Eyes are the hunting traps of Satan
